column5: Anyone have info on water levels just north of Thunder Bay. Have heard they are extremely low? Any info would be appreciated. Heading up in 23 days.
We fly out of Armstrong every year and are expecting low to very low water this year. Our outfitter lives in Thunder Bay in the winter and has forwarned us of this possibility,

Water levels in the rivers that enter the north shore of Superior are very low for this time of year. The steelhead fishing has been spotty the past few weeks, but the fish are around. Unless significan train comes, you can expect very low water. If you want details on specific rivers/lakes in that area, the thunderbayfishing.com message board will put yuo in touch with many avid anglers who specifically fish that area. NWO Fishing Bum
I'am guessing but it sounds like we use the same outfitter. We fly in May 19 wilderness north is the outfitter going to ogoki lake. If you use the same outfitter please respond.
